name: VMRay
description: This app enables you to detonate files and URLs, and perform investigative actions, using the VMRay Platform, thereby giving you automated analysis and advanced threat detection through an agentless hypervisor-based sandbox

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity
Download a file from the VMRay Platform and add it to the vault
actions.verbose: Downloads the file with the given hash from the VMRay Platform and adds it to the vault. This action returns a vault id which can be used to detonate the file.

hash.description: The hash of the file to be downloaded

actions.description: Detonate file in the VMRay Platform
actions.verbose: The file_name parameter overrides the filename, if none is given the app tries to get the filename from the vaults metadata. The type overrides the automatic detection of the VMRay Platform. The config parameter specifies additional configuration options passed to the VMRay Platform (See user_config in the REST API documentation). With jobrules you can specify custom jobrule entries (See jobrule_enries in the REST API documentation).

vault_id.description: The vault_id of the file to be analyzed

ioc_only.description: Only import artifacts that are IOCs

actions.description: Detonate a URL in the VMRay Platform
actions.verbose: See detonate file for a detailed parameter description.

ioc_only.description: Only import artifacts that are IOCs

actions.description: Get the report(s) for a submission
actions.verbose: This action requires a submission_id. The timeout parameter specifies the time to wait for the report to be finished before aborting this action. The timeout is specified in seconds. Zero indicates no wait, hence the action will return immediately. If this option is not set it will default to a five-minute timeout.

ioc_only.description: Only import artifacts that are IOCs

actions.description: Get information of a specific sample
actions.verbose: This action gets information about a sample given its hash. See get report for a description of the timeout parameter.
